subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A new hack?
author: Wiliam Clarke
full_text:
--0-2030898785-1206990450=:54648
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Frank
   
  This is probably a stupid question, what type of program can I use to open this file?
   
  Thanks
  Rees

Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
           I mounted the '469 guts on a board, and added a 3 volt regulator to run the RS radio off the 12 volt supply. I have the sweep working so far, hopefully tomorrow I can test the radio with external sweep to see if it actually works. The frequency display is now useless, so it's face down, and the power and band buttons will be added to a new front panel. I'm not sure if I want to make this direct out, or make it just like any other box. The audio should be more better than anything I've done so for, at least it sounded real good when I was using a manual control, but only could tune half the AM or FM bands wihtout the negative tuning voltage component. 
 
 The radio playing in the background is just C2C on a regular radio. 
 
 Frank-S
